page.title: 16ARTS AND CRAFT IN KILMERSDON
page.content: Several who seek to make a living from their artistic skills have found a home in the Kilmersdon area. One group share a workshop converted from old farm buildings where they do wrought-iron work, strip furniture and make it. The disused Methodist chapel has been utilised by a Stone Mason specialising in large sculptures. He has helped in the restoration work at Wells Cathedral. The couple who run the Herb Farm have a craft shop where they sell anything made to a high enough standard - knitwear, clothing, pottery, woodwork, basket-weaving and honey. Like other communities, there are many gifted amateurs of craft and skills encouraged by the W.I. These include flower-arranging, homecrafts, lace-work, handicrafts in general and photography. An exhibition is held in the courtroom to sell their wares.
